content.text: Calculate the energy, in joules, stored in the battery when fully charged
energy =   .........  J

Calculate the time for which the battery can power the bicycle

Calculate the upward force \(F\) exerted by the cord on the \(3.0 \text{kg}\) object
Show that the speed of the objects \(0.80 \text{s}\) after release is \(3.2 \text{m/s}\)

A card, of width \(2.0 \text{cm}\), is fixed to the \(2.0 \text{kg}\) object. As the \(2.0 \text{kg}\) object moves to the left, the card passes through a beam of light that is perpendicular to the card
Using the speed given in (c)(i), calculate the time taken for the card to pass through the beam of light
The objects have a constant acceleration

The \(2.0 \text{kg}\) object is released from rest and accelerates at \(4.0 \text{m/s}^2\)
Fig. 3.1 shows water in a river moving parallel to the river bank at \(4.0 \text{m / s}\) and a canoe travelling in the river
The canoe travels at \(2.5 \text{m / s}\) relative to the water and heads at an angle of \(38^{\circ}\) to the river bank
Draw a scale diagram to determine the canoe's resultant velocity and state the scale you used
scale
magnitude of resultant velocity
direction of resultant velocity (angle from the river bank)

explanation
